USA 101

USA 101

KNOW your states
map.google.com
States at Stake Game - http://www.purposegames.com/game/states-of-the-usa-quiz
NBA locations - [[posterous-content:oelAezjIFccmsxpechrz]]

unfamiliar states by date joining Union
Delaware
- tiny state, 2nd smallest
- first state to ratify constitution
- boundary between Penn & Delaware is a twelve mile circle that is many arcs feathered together

Georgia

- last state of the original 13
- one of the confederate states
- capital is Atlanta
- part of Appalachia

Maryland

- wide range of topography
- Chespeake bay
- long sea coast

Virginia
- first permanent New World English colony
- used to be conservative, joined the confederacy
- now more moderate
- place of Pocahontas

South Carolina
- first state to vote to secede from Union
- not much snow in South Carolina

Kentucky

- bluegrass (plant) is common because of fertile soil
- allows high quality livestock
- diverse environments

West Virginia

- broke away from West Virginia during Civil war. 
- US Census considers it part of the South
- part of Appalachia
- the mountain state

Ohio

- part of the MidWest
- status as swing state and bellwether
- because of proximity to industrial places and population and Lake Ohio, great transportation advantage

Tennessee
- was initially part of North Carolina
- center of racial strife - Klu Klux Klan, Martin Luther King's assassination in Memphis
- center of early rock n roll is Memphis; center of country music is Nashville
- Eastern part of state is part of Appalachia
- more south than Kentucky

Mississippi
- composed of entirely lowlands
- weirdly, Mississippi river doesn't enter the sea there

Louisiana
- multicultural, multilingual backgrounds
- very flat
- separated into lowlands and above-sea-land
- unequaled waterway system in the country

Texas

- was once a republic
- not all desert, less than 10%
- center of cowboy industry

Missouri
- bellwether state
- both Midwestern and Southern state influences
- originally considered Southern. now considered Midwestern
- Kansas City is eastern-most Western city
- St Louis is western most Eastern City

Arkansas********
- Algonquin name of a tribe
- has highlands and delta of Mississippi river
- part of Bible belt

Wisconsin
- north, cold
- long lake shore of Lake Michigan

Iowa********
- derives name from Ioway people, Native Americans
- Food Capital of the World

Oregon
- lots of forests
- explorers and settlers created the first autonomous government

Minnesota

- Land of 10,000 lakes
- lots of recreational opportunities
- majority of residents are German or Noridc descent

Utah

- people of the mountain in Ute language
- one of the most religiously homogeneous states (Mormon)
- very urbanized. everyone lives in Salt Lake City

Washington 

- land of contrasts
- 60% lives close to Seattle

Kansas
- named after Kansas tribe
- people of the wind
- Geographic "center" of USA. supposed to be on a private farm but farmer didn't want tourists.
but the calculation method isn't accurate anyway because it was decided by balancing USA-shaped cardboard on a point

Nebraska********
- leading agricultural and ranching state
- part of the Great American desert

Colorado
- centennial state, admitted on 100th year of independence
- vivid landscape
- all 30 major summits of Rockies are in Colorado
- four states meet at the "Four Corner"

Nevada
- Silver state because large silver deposits found here
- joined the Union during Civil war
- 86% of land owned federally
- mostly Mojave desert

North Dakota
- half way between Great Lakes and Pacific Ocean

South Dakota
- agriculture and ranching are primary industries

Idaho
- Gem state, every gem has been known to be found here

Montana

- spanish for mountains
- ranching, farming

Wyoming********

- dominated by mountain ranges
- eastern most part is still high plains

Oklahoma
- severe weather
- part of the Great Plains
- part of Bible belt, one of the most politically conservative

New Mexico

- consists of mostly Navajo and Pueblo people

Related terms:
Appalachia

Dixie - nickname for the South
